member.name: T:NServiceBus.CallbackExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods to configure callbacks on .

member.name: M:NServiceBus.CallbackExtensions.EnableCallbacks(NServiceBus.EndpointConfiguration,System.Boolean)
member.param: The value that indicates whether the endpoint can make callback requests. If true, the endpoint must be uniquely addressable.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.RequestResponseExtensions.Request``1(NServiceBus.IMessageSession,System.Object)
member.summary: Sends a to the configured destination and returns back a which can be awaited.
member.remarks: The task returned is non durable. When the AppDomain is unloaded or the response task is canceled. Messages can still arrive to the requesting endpoint but in that case no handling code will be attached to consume that response message and therefore the message will be moved to the error queue.
member.returns: A task which contains the response when it is completed.

member.name: M:NServiceBus.RequestResponseExtensions.Request``1(NServiceBus.IMessageSession,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends a to the configured destination and returns back a which can be awaited.
member.remarks: The task returned is non durable. When the AppDomain is unloaded or the response task is canceled. Messages can still arrive to the requesting endpoint but in that case no handling code will be attached to consume that response message and therefore the message will be moved to the error queue.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the request.
member.returns: A task which contains the response when it is completed.

member.summary: Sends a to the configured destination and returns back a which can be awaited.
member.remarks: The task returned is non durable. When the AppDomain is unloaded or the response task is canceled. Messages can still arrive to the requesting endpoint but in that case no handling code will be attached to consume that response message and therefore the message will be moved to the error queue.
member.returns: A task which contains the response when it is completed.

member.remarks: The task returned is non durable. When the AppDomain is unloaded or the response task is canceled. Messages can still arrive to the requesting endpoint but in that case no handling code will be attached to consume that response message and therefore the message will be moved to the error queue.
